Ekonomi RI Lesu, Pengusaha Ogah Kembangkan Bisnis
05 Nov 2019, 23:01 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: pool

Jakarta - Pengusaha merespons lesunya pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia. Berdasarkan catatan Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS), pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia di kuartal III-2019 sebesar 5,02% year on year (yoy). Angka ini jauh lebih rendah dari kuartal III-2018 sebesar 5,17%.Kepala BPS Suhariyanto mengatakan, catatan nilai pertumbuhan ekonomi kuartal III ini disebabkan realisasi investasi yang masih rendah.Lantas apa sikap yang diambil pengusaha dengan pertumbuhan ekonomi yang mungkin belum memuaskan itu?Pengusaha memilih menahan diri dan tidak melakukan ekspansi bisnis di tengah lesunya pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional.Ketua Umum Kamar Dagang dan Industri (Kadin) Indonesia Rosan P. Roeslani menjelaskan saat ini pengusaha memilih untuk menunda ekspansi. Bila ekonomi sudah tumbuh baik baru mereka akan ekspansi kembali."Iya kita menahan dulu (untuk melakukan ekspansi bisnis)," kata Rosan di Hotel Indonesia Kempinski, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11/2019).Dia menjelaskan hal tersebut dipengaruhi oleh supply and demand atau penawaran dan permintaan. Bila permintaan sedikit maka pengusaha tidak akan melakukan ekspansi. Sebaliknya, bila permintaan meningkat maka mereka akan ekspansi."Kembali lagi hukumnya supply and demand. Begitu demand-nya lemah kita akan ekspansi nggak? Pasti akan nahan. Begitu demand-nya tinggi apa kita akan lebih ekspansi? Iya," terangnya.Lanjut ke halaman berikutnya >>> (ang/ang)

RI Economy Sluggish, Entrepreneurs Are Unwilling to Develop Business
05 Nov 2019, 23:01 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: pool

Jakarta - Entrepreneurs respond to Indonesia's sluggish economic growth. Based on the records of the Central Statistics Agency (BPS), Indonesia's economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 amounted to 5.02% year on year (yoy). This figure is much lower than the quarter III-2018 of 5.17%. Head of BPS Suhariyanto said the record value of economic growth in the third quarter was due to investment realization that was still low. What was the attitude taken by entrepreneurs with economic growth that might not have been satisfactory? Entrepreneurs choose to hold back and not expand their business in the midst of sluggish national economic growth. Indonesian General Chairman of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin) Rosan P. Roeslani explained that at this time entrepreneurs chose to postpone expansion. When the economy grows well then they will expand again. "Yes, we will hold back first (to expand the business)," Rosan said at the Hotel Indonesia Kempinski, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). He explained that this was influenced by supply and demand or supply and demand. If there is little demand, entrepreneurs will not expand. Conversely, if demand increases, they will expand. "Again, the law of supply and demand. Once demand is weak, we will expand or not? Surely it will endure. When demand is high, will we expand further? Yes," he explained. next page >>> (ang / ang)
